summary: This document contains a cover letter from Shanta Clayton of AT&T California, certifying the authenticity of records provided in response to a subpoena related to the Epstein case. It details the nature of the records and the legal process under which they were produced, including call billing and service records.

persons.name: Shanta Clayton
persons.context: Shanta Clayton certifies the authenticity of the records provided by AT&T California in response to a subpoena.

persons.name: Jeffrey H. Simians
persons.context: Jeffrey H. Simians is mentioned as the Assistant United States Attorney requesting the early voluntary turnover of subpoenaed materials.

events.title: Certification of Records
events.description: Shanta Clayton certifies the records provided in response to a subpoena related to the Epstein case.

locations: One AT&T Plaza, 10th Floor, 208 S. Akard, Dallas, Texas 75202
701 Clematis Street, West Palm Beach, Florida 33401
keyFacts: The document is a cover letter certifying the authenticity of records provided by AT&T California.
The records include call billing and service records related to the Epstein case.
Shanta Clayton is authorized to certify the records as true and correct copies.
The document mentions a subpoena issued to produce records for a Federal Grand Jury in the Southern District of Florida.
The records cover a timeframe from January 1, 2004, to December 31, 2006.
